text.0: well knowing i have bound me horselike to the pole i carry that which bears as on and gives us help.
text.1: i seek for no release no turning back therefrom may he who knows the way the leader guide me straight.
text.2: o agni indra varuṇa and mitra give o ye gods and marut host and viṣṇu.
text.3: may both nāsatyas rudra heavenly matrons pūṣan sarasvatī bhaga accept us.
text.4: indra and agni mitra varuṇa aditi the waters mountains maruts sky and earth and heaven.
text.5: viṣṇu i call pūṣan and brahmaṇaspati and bhaga samsa savitar that they may help.
text.6: may viṣṇu also and vāta who injures none and soma granter of possessions give us joy.
text.7: and may the Ṛbhus and the aśvins tvaṣṭar and vibhvan remember us so that we may have wealth.
text.8: so may the band of maruts dwelling in the sky the holy come to us to sit on sacred grass.
text.9: bṛhaspati and pūṣan grant us sure defence varuṇa mitra aryaman guard and shelter us.
text.10: and may the mountains famed in noble eulogies and the fairgleaming rivers keep us safe from harm.
text.11: may bhaga the dispenser come with power and grace and farpervading aditi listen to my call.
text.12: may the gods spouses aid us of their own freewill aid us to offspring and the winning of the spoil.
text.13: grant us protection o ye gracious goddesses ye who are on the earth or in the waters realm.
text.14: may the dames wives of gods enjoy our presents rat aśvini agnāyī and indrāṇī.
text.15: may rodasī and varuṇānī hear us and goddesses come at the matrons season.
